intro: Tetranthera rubra, commonly known as redstem tetranthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its slender, red-stemmed structure. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are often borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Tetranthera rubra is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
